description: Vice President Kamala Harris addressed abortion rights at a campaign event in Wisconsin on Monday. CBS News campaign reporters Nidia Cavazos, Shawna Mizelle and Zak Hudak are across the country covering key locations on the trail.
title: Vice President Harris speaks on abortion rights in Wisconsin

description: A new book titled "Finish What We Started: The MAGA Movement's Ground War to End Democracy" examines the origins, evolution and future of the "Make America Great Again" movement. Author and Washington Post reporter Isaac Arnsdorf joins "America Decides" to discuss what went into the book.
title: How Trump reshaped the GOP, and what it could mean for the nation's future

description: President Biden is condemning antisemitism in the U.S. as protests against the Israel-Hamas war break out at universities across the nation. Nancy Cordes, David Weigel and Deepa Shivaram join with more.
title: Biden condemns antisemitism amid wave of college protests

description: President Biden was on the campaign trail in Virginia on Monday for an Earth Day event, while former President Donald Trump spent the day inside a Manhattan courtroom. Michael Tyler, communications director for the Biden campaign, joins CBS News to discuss the latest in the 2024 race.
title: Biden commemorates Earth Day while Trump attends court

description: The Senate is expected to vote Tuesday on the foreign aid bills passed by the House over the weekend, but the move could cost Speaker Mike Johnson his job. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion reports.
title: Foreign aid heads to Senate as ouster threat looms over Johnson

description: A new CBS poll finds that most of the public favors the U.S. taking steps to address climate change. CBS News executive director of elections and surveys Anthony Salvanto breaks down the numbers.
title: Most Americans support efforts to address climate change, CBS News poll finds

description: Lawyers presented their opening statements and the first witness took the stand Monday in former President Donald Trump's New York criminal trial. CBS News chief election and campaign correspondent Robert Costa has more.
title: Key takeaways from opening statements in Trump "hush money" trial

description: Proposed deal "threatens to deprive consumers of the competition for affordable handbags," federal agency says.
title: FTC sues to block $8.5 billion merger of Coach and Michael Kors owners

description: As pro-Palestinian protests on Columbia University's campus continue, New York City Mayor Eric Adams says officials hope to hold meetings with colleges in the city over ways to handle rising tensions without infringing on protesters' rights. CBS News' Lilia Luciano and Ben Tracy spoke to Adams about the protests amid concerns about antisemitism.
title: New York City officials to meet with colleges over protests, Mayor Adams says

description: Climate change could cause a $38 trillion income loss per year globally by 2049, according to a new study by the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research. CBS News' Lilia Luciano breaks down the numbers.
title: Breaking down climate change's economic impacts

description: Protesters have been arrested at Columbia and Yale as they've refused to move, calling for a break from Israel.
title: Biden condemns "antisemitic protests" on college campuses

description: A recent report by the United Nations warned that 1 million species are at risk of extinction because of climate-related issues, and some scientists say the number could be even higher. CBS News national environmental correspondent David Schechter has more.
title: Future of many species in jeopardy, U.N. report says

description: Facing widespread unhappiness over its response to the Israel-Hamas war, the writers' group PEN America has called off its annual awards ceremony.
title: PEN America calls off awards ceremony amid criticism over response to Israel-Hamas war

description: A bill that could ultimately ban TikTok in the U.S. will soon head for a vote in the Senate. Here's what experts say to expect next.
title: A TikTok ban was passed by the House. Here's what could happen next.

description: Those who prioritize climate change feel somewhat unsatisfied — more of them feel Biden has done too little.
title: Even those who care most about climate have heard little of Biden's policies

description: Discover what's new in the 2024 edition of Samsung's popular Frame smart art TV.
title: Samsung's 2024 Frame TV is finally here

description: 5.55% is an impressive high-yield savings account interest rate. But how much money would you earn with it?
title: What will a 5.55% high-yield savings account earn in 6 months?

description: Gift your high school graduate the best computers from Apple, HP, Lenovo and more.
title: Best laptops for high school grads

description: Cancer, heart disease, respiratory illnesses and kidney dysfunction among the health consequences of a warming planet.
title: Climate change a health risk for 70% of world's workers, UN warns

description: Jurors in former President Donald Trump's "hush money" trial heard opening statements Monday. After the jury was introduced to the case, the prosecution called David Pecker, a former CEO of American Media Inc., to the stand. CBS News national correspondent Errol Barnett and CBS News legal contributor Rebecca Roiphe have the latest.
title: First witness called in Trump "hush money" trial after jury hears opening statements

description: The Supreme Court heard arguments Monday over local laws to combat homeless encampments in Grants Pass, Oregon. The court will weigh whether the laws banning public camping violate the Eighth Amendment. CBS News' Carter Evans reports.
title: Supreme Court weighs constitutionality of anti-camping ordinances

description: Liven up your patio and get much-needed sun coverage with the best patio umbrellas of 2024.
title: The best patio umbrellas of 2024 deliver the ultimate shade for under $150

description: The Senate is expected to begin voting Tuesday on a set of bills passed by the House over the weekend to approve funds for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan. House Speaker Mike Johnson's leadership position may be in jeopardy for his work with Democrats to pass the funding package. CBS News congressional correspondent Nikole Killion has the latest.
title: Is Mike Johnson's speakership in jeopardy for foreign aid moves?

description: A public inquiry will shed light on how thousands of people in the United Kingdom were infected with HIV and hepatitis C after some took part in a treatment using donated human blood plasma in the 1970s. Investigative reporter Guy Lynn from BBC News, a CBS News partner, has more.
title: U.K. blood scandal inquiry ends in May

description: A "concierge service" that lets paying members bypass airport security lines is unfair to other travelers, California lawmaker says.
title: California could ban Clear, which lets travelers pay to skip TSA lines

description: These robot vacuums from Lefant, Shark and more will keep your floors clean. But they won't break the bank.
title: The best budget robot vacuums under $250 can clean up without cleaning you out

description: Columbia University held classes online Monday as pro-Palestinian campus protests entered a sixth day. CBS News' Meg Oliver reports on heightened campus security, and Sam Vinograd, a CBS News contributor and former counterterrorism official, breaks down the government's response to antisemitism in the U.S.
title: Fears of antisemitism at Columbia University as protests continue

description: The Environmental Protection Agency on Monday announced $7 billion worth of federal grants for projects that will provide solar energy to 900,000 low-income and disadvantaged households. John Podesta, a senior advisor to President Biden on international climate policy, joins CBS News with more.
title: Biden admin. announces $7 billon solar energy investment

description: An alligator had fixed its jaws around Will Georgitis' arm in South Carolina and dragged him 50 feet underwater.
title: Alligator attack victim reveals how he survived: "I knew I was going to die"

description: If you're in your 80s, you may be wondering if you can still qualify for long-term care insurance. Find out here.
title: Can you buy long-term care insurance in your 80s?

description: Shop our picks for some of the best headphones you'll find under $100 from top brands like Apple, JBL, Anker, and more.
title: Best headphones under $100

description: Shop our picks for some of the best headphones you'll find under $100 from top brands like Apple, JBL, Anker, and more.
title: Best headphones under $100

description: Ukraine is readying soldiers for a major Russian offensive that is expected in the coming months, with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urging allies to send his country weapons. Washington Post reporter Mary Ilyushina joined CBS News to discuss the latest developments in the Russia-Ukraine war.
title: Concerns of Russian offensive in Ukraine, Zelenskyy pushing allies for weapons

description: Many Americans see an economic cost to combating climate change.
title: Climate politics and the bottom line — CBS News poll

description: A 2019 U.N. report found around 1 million plant and animal species could be threatened with extinction, but new research shows climate change could drive that number up to 6 million over the next 50 years. Wildlife ecologist Rae Wynn-Grant joined CBS News to discuss.
title: New research shows millions of species could face extinction due to climate change

description: Tesla reduced prices by $2,000 on three of its five models in the U.S. The company also cut prices in China and Germany.
title: Tesla cuts prices around the globe amid slowing demand for its EVs

description: Long-term care insurance offers more benefits than you'd expect. Here are a few that may surprise you.
title: 5 surprising long-term care insurance benefits you should know

description: Considering investing in physical gold? Here are three reasons why you should do so this month.
title: 3 reasons to buy gold bars and coins this April

description: His donations over the years have been funded entirely by his personal savings, including money he invested from his earnings in the stock market.
title: Meet "Toy Man," a humble humanitarian who's brought joy to thousands of kids

description: A new report calls for further study into a possible link between chronic wasting disease in deer and a rare and deadly brain disease in humans.
title: Contaminated deer meat may have caused 2 hunters' deadly brain diseases

description: Designer whose accessories were worn by characters in "Sex and the City" TV series sentenced to 18 months in prison.
title: Celebrity designer faces prison for smuggling crocodile handbags

description: Matthew Hussey hosts the popular podcast "Love Life with Matthew Hussey."
title: The riskiest moment in dating, according to Matthew Hussey

description: President Biden is urging the Senate to move quickly to approve foreign aid legislation that finally passed the House over the weekend. House Speaker Mike Johnson allowed the bills to come up for a vote, despite threats to oust him from some hard-line Republicans. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has more.
title: Senate to vote on foreign aid package, speaker facing some GOP backlash for allowing House vote

description: Save money on Sony's latest over-the-counter hearing aids.
title: Sony's over-the-counter hearing aids are up to $300 off

description: Having your debt sent to collections is never a good thing, but there are some easy ways to tackle what you owe.
title: 5 simple ways to pay off debt in collections

description: Millions of Americans filed their taxes during the last two weeks of this year's tax season. Here's how to find out when you'll get your refund.
title: Here's how to track the status of your 2024 tax refund

description: Protesters demanding Yale University divest from military manufacturers and expressing "solidarity with Gaza" were detained Monday as demonstrations spilled out into the streets.
title: Yale students arrested amid pro-Palestinian protest

description: CBS News climate producer Chris Spinder got into the water as sharks circled below. In this producer's notebook, he shares what he learned after a minor, but bloody, injury.
title: A CBS News producer shares his surprising shark encounter

description: The So Much To Give Inclusive Cafe in Cedars, Pennsylvania employs 63 people — 80% have a disability.
title: Mom opens cafe to employ people with disabilities

description: New York Attorney General Letitia James's office argued it is concerned about the financial wherewithal of Knight Specialty Insurance company, which posted the bond for former President Donald Trump.
title: Trump's $175 million bond can stand after attorneys agree to comply with new conditions

description: Are you shopping for a new home? Here's why you may (and may not) want to lock in your rate before the Fed meets.
title: Should you lock in your mortgage rate before the April Fed meeting?

description: A mom was worried about what her son, who has autism, would do after high school. So she opened the So Much To Give cafe, a restaurant in Cedars, Pennsylvania, that employs people with disabilities – and helps them grow.
title: Mom opens cafe to employ people with disabilities

description: After a U.S. investment of about $1 billion in Niger, the welcome mat is being yanked out from under American troops' feet.
title: Why the U.S. military's withdrawal from Niger is a "devastating blow"

description: The Spice Girls had a reunion on Saturday and even put on an impromptu performance.
title: Spice Girls reunite at Victoria Beckham's birthday party

description: Terry Anderson, the Associated Press correspondent who was held hostage by Islamic militants in Lebanon for nearly seven years, has died at his home in New York at the age of 76.
title: Journalist and former hostage Terry Anderson dies at 76

description: Opening statements will get underway Monday in Donald Trump's "hush money" criminal trial over his alleged payments to adult film star Stormy Daniels. Trump is the first former U.S. president to face a criminal trial. CBS News' Errol Barnett and Rebecca Roiphe have more.
title: What to expect from opening statements in Trump's "hush money" trial

description: Best-selling author and dating coach Matthew Hussey, known for his popular podcast "Love Life with Matthew Hussey" and his popular YouTube videos, unveils his new book, "Love Life: How to Raise Your Standards, Find Your Person, and Live Happily -- No Matter What."
title: Matthew Hussey shares secrets to finding love in new book

description: Former Miss USA and Extra correspondent Cheslie Kryst shared her excitement about writing her first book, finishing the manuscript shortly before she died by suicide in 2022, at age 30. Her family says she battled severe depression for years. Now, her mother, April Simpkins, is honoring her daughter's wish by publishing her book. It's called "By the Time You Read This: The Space Between Cheslie's Smile and Mental Illness." April Simpkins joins us first on "CBS Mornings." For more information on Cheslie Kryst go to cheslieckrystfoundation.org
title: April Simpkins publishes daughter Cheslie Kryst's posthumous book, "By the Time You Read This"

description: Video shows a heroic group effort to rescue a driver who was trapped inside a burning vehicle in Minnesota. Officials say the car drifted off the road on Interstate 94, hitting a light pole and a guard rail and igniting the fire.
title: Dashcam video shows heroic effort to rescue driver from burning car in Minnesota

description: Considering accessing your home equity now? Here's what you should do before the Federal Reserve meets again.
title: 3 smart home equity moves to make before the Fed's April Meeting

description: Video shows a heroic group effort to save the life of a driver stuck in a burning vehicle in St. Paul last week.
title: Video shows good Samaritans rescuing driver from burning car in St. Paul

description: Video shows a heroic group effort to save the life of a driver stuck in a burning vehicle in St. Paul last week.
title: Video shows good Samaritans rescuing driver from burning car in St. Paul

description: Gold prices are up. Here's how you can leverage them.
title: How to take advantage of gold's rising price, according to experts

description: In this web exclusive, “Sue,” a retiree who agreed to speak with CBS News under a pseudonym, says she became a victim of a romance scammer and lost her home and nearly $2.5 million to someone she met on Match.com. She says the fraudsters used technology (including deceptive Skype calls) and “psychological manipulation” to lure her in: “People say, how can you give money to a stranger? He wasn't a stranger at that point." [Don't miss the four-part CBS News Investigation "Anything for Love."]
title: Romance scam victim speaks out on "psychological manipulation" that cost her $2.5 million

description: Former President Donald Trump has arrived at a Manhattan courthouse where the judge and jury are set to hear opening statements in his criminal trial over alleged "hush money" payments to adult film actor Stormy Daniels. Trump is the first former U.S. president to face a criminal trial. Tony Dokoupil, Gayle King and Nate Burleson anchored CBS News' Special Report.
title: Trump arrives for opening statements in "hush money" trial | Special Report

description: The Supreme Court hears arguments Wednesday in a case about whether Idaho's near-total ban on abortion is preempted by Emergency Medical Treatment and Labor Act, or EMTALA.
title: Supreme Court to weigh Idaho abortion ban against federal law

description: Ohio-based clothing retailer intends to use bankruptcy process to facilitate sale of company to WHP Global.
title: Express files for bankruptcy, plans to close nearly 100 stores

description: The Supreme Court will consider a court fight over a rule from the Biden administration that imposed requirements on the manufacturers and sellers of ghost guns.
title: Supreme Court agrees to hear dispute over Biden administration's "ghost guns" rule

description: Home equity borrowing can help you afford important maintenance projects, but there could be some risks.
title: When to use home equity for spring repairs (and when not to), according to experts

description: There was another close call between airplanes last week, this time at New York's JFK Airport. A Swiss Air flight was cleared for takeoff at the same time four other planes were crossing the runway. Robert Sumwalt, executive director of the Boeing Center for Aviation and Aerospace Safety at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, joined CBS News to discuss the incident.
title: Swiss Air flight aborts takeoff in close call at JFK Airport

description: David Begnaud visits Jeffrey Olsen, known as the "Toy Man" in Vista, California, who has dedicated over 30 years to donating toys, food, and clothes to those in need.
title: "Toy Man" continues legacy of giving

description: The U.S. is reportedly expected to sanction a unit of IDF soldiers in the West Bank. CBS News has learned that the U.S. has been investigating them for alleged human rights violations, but Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is vowing to fight against any sanctions. CBS News foreign correspondent Imtiaz Tyab has more.
title: U.S. expected to sanction Israeli military unit for alleged human rights violations

description: Jan Crawford looks ahead at an important week for the Supreme Court. The justices will hear arguments on several contentious issues, including abortion limits and a claim by former President Trump that presidents have legal immunity for their actions in office. First, they'll hear a case focusing on homelessness and what can be done about it.
title: Supreme Court to hear major cases on homelessness, abortion, presidential immunity

description: Opening statements in Donald Trump’s “hush money” trial are set for Monday in a historic moment of the first-ever criminal trial of a former president of the United States. Trump faces 34 felony counts of falsifying business records. He’s accused of using his former lawyer, Michael Cohen, to funnel payments to adult film star Stormy Daniels.
title: Opening statements start Monday in Donald Trump’s “hush money” trial

description: Papua New Guinea's Prime Minister James Marape has accused President Biden of disparaging the South Pacific island nation by implying that an uncle had been eaten by "cannibals" there during World War II.
title: Biden implied his uncle was eaten by cannibals. Papua New Guinea's leader pushes back.

description: Opening statements will begin Monday morning in former President Donald Trump's "hush money" trial. Trump is the first former president to face criminal prosecution, he is accused of falsifying business records to hide an alleged affair with an adult film actor ahead of the 2016 election. Trump denies all charges. Attorney and CBS News campaign reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.
title: Opening statements to begin in Trump "hush money" trial

description: The United States is considering the unprecedented step of sanctioning members of the Israel Defense Forces in the West Bank for alleged human rights violations.
title: U.S. considers sanctioning some members of the IDF

description: Taylor Swift’s new album, “The Tortured Poets Department,'' became Spotify’s most-streamed album in a single day while selling 1.6 million units. It’s on track to sell more than 2 million copies in its first week
title: Taylor Swift’s new album, “The Tortured Poets Department,” breaks records

description: A tiny baby rescued from the womb after an Israeli airstrike in Gaza killed her mother is doing well after being moved to a new hospital.
title: Baby saved from dying mother's womb after Israeli airstrike named in her honor

description: CBS News legal analyst Rikki Klieman breaks down what to expect as opening statements start Monday in Donald Trump’s historic criminal trial.
title: Analysis of Donald Trump’s “hush money” trial as it begins

description: The House passed legislation over the weekend on foreign aid, sending it to the Senate. The bills provide $95 billion to Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan.
title: Foreign aid for Ukraine, Israel in hands of Senate after House passes bill over the weekend

description: Opening statements begin today at former President Donald Trump's criminal trial. Also, the Republican Speaker of the House defies his party's right wing to pass a foreign aid package with funding for Ukraine. All that and all that matters in today’s Eye Opener.
title: Eye Opener: Opening statements in Trump's criminal case begin today

description: A process called cryopreservation allows cells to remain frozen but alive for hundreds of years. For some animal cells, the moon is the closest place that's cold enough.
title: Could some species dying on Earth be saved in outer space?

description: More than 100 nations have agreed to protect 30% of the world’s oceans by 2030. One way of doing this is to create what are known as Marine Protected Areas, where human activity is restricted or banned. Ben Tracy reports on how a mix of AI and satellite vessel tracking data can help.
title: How AI and innovative technology are helping countries to protect ocean life

description: More than 100 nations, including the United States, have agreed to protect 30% of the world's oceans by 2030.
title: How countries are using innovative technology to preserve ocean life

description: Terry Anderson, the globe-trotting Associated Press correspondent who became one of America's longest-held hostages, has died at age 76.
title: Terry Anderson, reporter held hostage for years in Lebanon, dies at 76

description: Israel's leader says he'll fight any U.S. sanctions against his forces stemming from alleged pre-Gaza war human rights violations.
title: Israel lashes out over possible U.S. sanctions against army battalion

description: The Supreme Court will weigh whether efforts to address homelessness in Grants Pass, Oregon, violated the Constitution's prohibition on cruel and unusual punishment.
title: Supreme Court to weigh constitutionality of anti-camping ordinances

description: This Earth Day, learn about the millions of species of plants and animals – and the vital role they all play in the planet's future.
title: What is biodiversity?

description: 60 Minutes traveled to Madagascar back in 2012 to report on efforts being made to save endangered turtles and tortoises, including the plowshare tortoise, a species that remains at risk of extinction due to poaching for the illegal pet trade.
title: The race to save the tortoise | 60 Minutes Archive

description: To reduce recidivism, some rural counties are hiring community health workers or peer support specialists to connect people leaving custody to mental health, substance use treatment, medical services and jobs.
title: Rural jails turn to community health workers to help the newly released succeed

description: Poland is "ready" to host nuclear arms if NATO decides to deploy them there in the face of Russia reinforcing its armaments in Belarus and Kaliningrad, President Andrzej Duda says.
title: Poland "ready" to host NATO nuclear weapons, its president says

description: Inspired by protests at Columbia University, pro-Palestinians camps have been set up at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology and Emerson College.
title: MIT, Emerson College students start pro-Palestinian camps

description: Masked men stopped a vehicle carrying Mexico's leading presidential candidate, Claudia Sheinbaum, while she was traveling between campaign stops. They had a request in the event she wins the June 2 election.
title: Masked men stop vehicle carrying Mexico's leading presidential candidate

description: Former National Enquirer publisher David Pecker is expected to be called as the first witness in Trump's "hush money" trial in New York.
title: Trump "hush money" trial opening statements set for today

description: Over half of U.S. counties face potentially higher utility expenses as the mercury rises, a new analysis finds.
title: Hotter temperatures mean higher utility costs for millions of Americans

description: Mary J. Blige, Cher, Foreigner, A Tribe Called Quest, Kool & The Gang, Ozzy Osbourne, Dave Matthews Band and Peter Frampton have been named to the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame.
title: Rock & Roll Hall of Fame's latest class includes Mary J. Blige and Cher

description: Erin Patterson, accused of serving her ex-husband's parents and an aunt poisonous mushrooms, appeared in an Australian court again, charged with three counts of murder and five of attempted murder​.
title: Alleged poison mushroom killer of 3 appears in Australian court again

description: The Aurora Police Department tweeted Sunday evening that officers are searching for a stolen SUV that had a 6-year-old girl inside of it.
title: Aurora police search for stolen SUV with 6-year-old girl inside

description: Foreign automakers dominate U.S. News' list of the best new EVs and hybrids, while Tesla is shut out.
title: U.S. News lists its best electric and hybrid vehicles for 2024

description: House passes aid bill, some Republicans call for speaker's ouster; How climate change could impact forests
title: 4/21: CBS Weekend News

description: First, Gina Raimondo: The 60 Minutes Interview. Then, a report on the forgotten Nazi camp built on British soil. And, Kevin Hart: The 60 Minutes Interview.
title: 4/21/2024: Secretary of Commerce; On British Soil; Kevin Hart

description: Democratic Congressman Ro Khanna joins The Takeout to discuss President Biden's approach to immigration, the economy & conflict in the Middle East.  Khanna talks Biden's outlook in the 2024 election, America's electoral future & a teacher who inspired him.
title: 4/21: The Takeout: Ro Khanna

description: Federal law enforcement officials have brought charges against Xisen Guo, who is accused of creating an illicit marijuana-growing operation off the beaten path in rural Maine.
title: Feds bust another illegal grow house in Maine
